data.title: Hasso Plattner Institute NYC
data.meta_description: Hasso Plattner Institute NYC | 3,451 followers on LinkedIn. HPI New York – Solving global challenges through digital engineering, collaboration, and design thinking. | The Hasso Plattner Institute (HPI) is unparalleled on the German university landscape. HPI offers unique innovation-oriented and practically-based Bachelor’s and Master’s of Science degree programs in "IT-Systems Engineering."​ In addition, HPI offers a supplemental study program in the innovation method of Design Thinking.
data.text:
Just coming back from a wonderful breakfast event with about 30 participants from many fields at the American Council on Germany, talking about #DataQuality and #AI (of course). The questions we discussed ranged from data preparation ("open" data served as pdf-file) to measuring completeness to the differences of AI and privacy policies in the US and Europe. Many thanks to Steven E Sokol for the kind invitation and to Joann Halpern for making the connection!

How Design Thinking helps innovate 💡 Yesterday we were invited to Hasso Plattner Institute NYC by its director, Joann Halpern. The New York office expands HPI's global reach and is part of the global Design Thinking Alliance. Despite the breathtaking view, I would like to share the following insights with you: 🏳️🌈 Multidisciplinary teams: With diverse teams, ideas can be generated beyond everyone's own discipline. This is faster and more sustainable. 💭 Variable space: Where do you get your best ideas? In the shower, while exercising? Ideas are best generated in a flexible working environment. That is why flexible furniture and lots of moderation tools are highly recommended. 🔄 Iterative process: By using a human-centered and iterative process, teams arrive at desirable solutions. You should go for quantity and fail early and often. Even if you can't implement the whole design thinking approach, you should at least aim for parts of it. Thank you for the invitation, Joann Halpern! It was our pleasure!

𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗴 𝗠𝗶𝗻𝗱𝘀, 𝗦𝗺𝗮𝗿𝘁 𝗠𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀–𝗖𝗵𝗮𝘁𝗚𝗣𝗧 & 𝗖𝗼 𝗶𝗻 𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗖𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗲𝗿 Join German Center for Research and Innovation (DWIH) New York, several 𝗚𝗲𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻 𝘁𝗼𝗽 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵 𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 (see list below), DAAD German Academic Exchange Service and DFG North America to learn about how to efficiently use AI and LLM to advance your research and career! We cordially invite young researchers from all academic disciplines to this next '𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗚𝗲𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝘆 𝗮 𝗣𝗮𝗿𝘁 𝗼𝗳 𝗜𝘁!' event at the German House in NYC on August 26th at 5:30 PM. Don't miss out on this opportunity with keynotes, university pitches, meetings with representatives of German universities and funding organizations, as well as drinks and snacks. Gain valuable insights on how to boost your research and career from both German and American perspectives. Keynotes by 💬 Annette 'Nina' Gray, Assistant Vice Provost for Research Planning and Analysis at New York University 💬 Daniel Mertens, Scientist & Coach, Ulm University Moderator: 🎤 Joann Halpern, Director Hasso Plattner Institute NYC Participating universities: University Alliance Ruhr featuring RUB Research School, Technische Universität Berlin and Freie Universität Berlin, Hasso Plattner Institute NYC, University of Cologne, Campus OWL New York, The University of Freiburg. The event is free of charge but RSVP is required. Register now and spread the word! https://lnkd.in/dX6HSjMe

I am so fortunate to have such talented and innovative colleagues at the Hasso Plattner Institute in Potsdam, Germany. This morning at the SAP and Hasso Plattner Institute NYC offices, we learned about some of the cutting-edge #research being conducted by Prof. Vaibhav Bajpai and his research group at #HPI. We also had the opportunity to experience Prof. Bajpai in action, and there is no question that he deserves the #TUM teaching award he received several years ago before joining the faculty of HPI. I was particularly intrigued to learn about #DNS resiliency and efficiency as well as the performance trade-offs associated with encrypting DNS traffic. Prof. Bajpai introduced us to a forward-looking protocol design that harmonizes performance with #privacy, resulting in the best of both worlds: enhanced privacy for DNS and #securewebcommunication. 👏 Kudos to the audience for the great questions during the Q&A. Many new networks were formed both prior to and after Prof. Bajpai's outstanding presentation. A very special thank you to Katja Schroeder for bringing so many of your colleagues to the event and to HPI Professor Gerard de Melo, who joined us after engaging in an enlightening book discussion at the German Consulate General New York yesterday.

Earlier today, in partnership with the German Consulate General New York, the Hasso Plattner Institute NYC organized a breakfast discussion featuring Prof. Hilke Schellmann, author of "The Algorithm: How AI Decides Who Gets Hired, Monitored, Promoted, and Fired and Why We Need to Fight Back Now," and Prof. Gerard de Melo, chair of Artificial Intelligence and Intelligent Systems at the Hasso Plattner Institute in Potsdam, Germany. The lively discussion, enriched by insightful questions from Prof. de Melo and convincing responses by Prof. Schellmann, focused on the ethical and social implications of #AI, including #privacy concerns, #algorithmicbias, and the impact on employment. Comments from both speakers highlighted the transformative potential and the stark challenges of AI in our society. The discussion, which involved active participation from an engaged audience, also touched on the need for #regulatoryframeworks and #ethicalguidelines to govern AI development and deployment. I highly recommend "The Algorithm," which is written in a very accessible style and provides readers with a comprehensive overview of the current state and future potential of AI, blending engaging narratives with in-depth research. Thank you, @Carsten Ruepke and Anna Ophira Schwarzkopf for the outstanding collaboration!
